intro: Ligusticum caucasicum, commonly known as Caucasian lovage, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its rhizomes and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Ligusticum caucasicum is also valued as a culinary herb, though its use is less common than other members of its family.
